page.title: 06SALMON FARMING,ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Salmon are held captive in Loch Broom in floating pens (nets supported by a floating collar) holding up to 5000 fish when transferred( aged 14 months, weighing 30-50g.) from the hatchery but reduced in number as the fish grow.These smolt are fed on compounded pellets containing mostly fish-meal and consume 800t.per annum. Remaining in this sea water for 2 years until their marketable size is 2-3kg. and 3-4kg.,they are then despatched,whole on ice,by lorry, in boxes of 10-25kg.to processors, smokers,supermarkets and various markets in U.K. and France. The salmon farm is expecting to produce 300 tonnes of marketable salmon during 1986/87. The farm employs twelve persons on a full-time basis.
